Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Sighs] I'm having second thoughts about one of the shirts I packed. The blue one with the stripes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm sure it's fine. it's a blue shirt.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, yeah, but I'm wondering if it's too blue. Like, am I making a statement with the blueness?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I am leaving early today for Philly, because tomorrow is the first day of my new job. So I figure I'd get in at 5:00, check into a hotel at about 6:00 so I can get a real good night of restless sleep and nervous puking.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, excuse me. Trying to get work done. Some people don't care about Jim's new sports job in Phila-Whatever.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So you know my job has something to do with sports, but you don't know the end of the word "Philadelphia"?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Philadelphia. From the greek phila meaning "Love," and adelph, meaning "Adolf." "the city that loves Adolf." Good luck with your new enterprise and don't wear the blue striped shirt. It makes your neck look like an old mop handle.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Pam looks at Jim and nods her head in agreement]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh...Hey, guys, the Christmas party is today. Merry Christmas everyone!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Is It?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I mean, it says "X-Mas party," but I think we all know what that's code for.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: So we're not going to have a Christmas party this year? Angela, how could you do this to us?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, right, like I'm responsible 'cause I'm in charge of the party planning committee.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well, you are the one in charge of it.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Don't blame me for something we all forgot.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah, let's not blame her for something we all forgot.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I didn't realize how many of Angela's opinions I agreed with, until she tried to have my kneecap shattered for sleeping with her husband. She makes a lot of very sound points.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I knew the party was today, but nobody asked me to plan it, so I didn't. Hmm, funny how that works.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [Scoffs] We're out there sweating our balls off every day, bustin' our balls. We deserve a Christmas party!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Well, then, why don't we just get some liquor and those mini-Cupcakes?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Mini-Cupcakes? As in the mini version of regular cupcakes, which is already a mini version of cake? Honestly, where does it end with you people?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What about an authentic Pennsylvania Dutch Christmas? Drink some gluhwein, enjoy some hasenpfeffer. Enjoy Christmas with saint Nicolas' rural German companion, Belsnickel.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes! That, that, that! We're definitely doing that. Are we all in agreement?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Done, right?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No. I want Tropical Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Topless Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Tapas swiss miss.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Spanish tapas, and swiss miss hot cocoa-What's so hard to understand?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Or, who was it that suggested the authentic Pennsylvania Dutch Christmas? I think it was someone really popular.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: We already said no.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Too weird.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Holds up a picture] This is me and my family celebrating Pennsylvania Dutch Christmas in 1982 on the farm. There's me and my brother Jeb breaking the ceremonial pig rib. He doesn't come back for Christmas anymore. The sepia tint is from an app on my phone. This is the same photo, matrix style.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm not understanding the confusion. Am I the only one who wants to try hufflepuffs and schnauzerhosen, and meet this glenpickle guy?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [Blows a weak whistle] Party planning cimmittee, emgergency meeting. Now.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm on it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: I'm just hoping German terrorists don't take over this Christmas party. Make me go all John McClane on their asses.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Wait, German terrorists? That's oddly specific. And I think-I think you mean John McCain.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Die hard reference.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I haven't seen it.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: You haven't seen die hard?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Mm-Mmm.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Why haven't you seen die hard?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I don't know, I just haven't.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Come on, you had to have at least seen some of it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: "now, i have a machine gun. Ho, ho, ho."

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: "Come out to the coast, we'll get together, have a few laughs."

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: None of this makes any sense to me!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, and when he takes the gun off his back, and he's like, "Yippie-Ki-Yay, mother-"

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Actually, he doesn't say that there. He says it earlier when he's on the radio with Hans.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes, you are right. Forgive me.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Oh, that's okay, bud.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nope. [Kevin walks out the door into the kitchen]

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Common mistake.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, it's not.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [Points and Pete] Nerd! Do you know every line of the movie?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: My brother dared me to memorize it, and I did it, and loved doing it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay, let's hear it.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Hear what?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Die hard. Every line. Go.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: "You don't like flying, do you?"

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Don't change the subject.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: No, that's the-

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Movie is starting.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [In Kitchen] We're thinking of collaborating with Mike Schmidt on some of his charity work.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I love Philly. Dirty town.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [Comes up behind Jim and puts his hands on Jim's shoulders] Ah-Ha-Ha! Philly! Exciting stuff, man.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: So you sure you remembered everything for your trip?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I think so.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Think that through for a sec.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, Jim's going to philly tomorrow. He said he was gonna take me with him, but that was two months ago. And I haven't heard anything since. I mean, he said that, right?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What else could you possibly be forgetting?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh-

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Things? People?

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Jim chuckles nervously]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You know who's not gonna get to work on some exciting new startup this year? George Howard Skub, a.k.a. the alleged Scranton strangler, because he's in prison [Jim and Daryl walk out of the kitchen] for something he may not have done.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, the-Uh, the Scranton who?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: The Scranton strangler. George Howard Skub. Haven't I told you about the jury I was on a couple years ago?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [Gasps] Oh, what happened? I mean, if you can talk about it, obviously. Because if you can't, I mean, I understand.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Stanley gets up and leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I-I could-I could talk about it.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [Pats Nellie on the shoulder as he's walking by her] See you next Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I could, sure. Have a seat. I would start at the beginning, but I think I need to go farther back.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We're the party planning committee, and we did not get where we are by playing it safe. We got here by being risk takers. And, yeah, Dwight's party is gonna be terrible. Maybe. Maybe it's not. Maybe it's going to be great. And if it's great...I think we all know what that would mean to us.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Let's do it!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes! Phyllis!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. I don't want my name attached to this party.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What does that even mean? Where would your name appear?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Please just take my name off of everything.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Just take her name off of everything.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Party Planning Committee walks out of The Conference Room]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Clears her throat] The party planning committee, minus Angela, has decided that we're all going to do Dwight's Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes! Yeah! [High Fives Jim] Yeah! Okay! Yes! It's a Christmas Miracle! [High Fives Pam] Yeah! Whoo-Hoo!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, there is one rule that you need to take very seriously.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And that is...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That there are no rules.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You have never been cooler.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Best Christmas ever.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Plays a trumpet] And Pennsylvania Dutch Christmas has officially begun.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Ugh. What is this stuff, lava?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That is gluhwein, otherwise known as glow-wine, also used to sterilize medical instruments. And, interesting factoid, this is the very spoon that guided my soft skull through the birth canal when I was born. Enjoy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What is it? [Jim lifts the hog maw with a fork] Don't touch it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Comes running up at startles Pam] Somebody's found the hog maw.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What? It's a Pennsylvania Dutch specialty. Hog maw. That's a beauty, isn't it? I don't even want to tell you what it's made of until after you try it.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Ugh. I'm not eating mystery meat.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It is stuffed pig stomach. And, after we finish it, we get to break the pig rib.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can't wait.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Weird. Where are the sugar cookies? Where's the karaoke machine?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is austere, Meredith. This is celebrating Christmas for all of the right reasons. The cookies and toys and sweets are mere distractions. I mean, most people don't even know that a candy cane represents a Shepherd's Crook, which I assure you does not taste like peppermint. It tastes like sheep feces.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: How would anyone even know-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Have you ever tasted a Shepherd's Crook?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know. Is it what you expected?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I feel like [Pam look's out the window and camera pans out in The Office]-Dwight is holding a candle and reading a poem.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So happy right now.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Jim and Pam get up and run out into The Office]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Speaking German] Wait, what is that I hear? Is someone on the roof? How strange. [Blows out the candle] Excuse me. I have to run to my car to take a dump.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I wish my car had a bathroom.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: "Let Heinrich plant the detonators and Theo prepare the vault. After that-"

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [On a computer, checking the script] Eh. That wasn't the line. I'm sorry, Pete.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: That is transcribed by some fan. They make mistakes.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I don't know. This looks pretty legit. [Erin's cell phone chimes] Oh, my gosh. I just got an email from Andy. That means they hit land.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [Reading the email from Andy] "What up, shorty? We got in last night, sold the boat, went out, got drunk, saw life of pi, got super depressed and introspective. Gonna hang out here a while. Maybe a couple of weeks. Figure this whole life thing out. Maybe see hobbit. Lates."

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Erin walks back to Pete and sits down at the computer]

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Hey. Everything okay?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: So what comes next?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Right, um, okay. So he says, uh, [Pete stands up] "After we call the police, they'll waste hours trying to negotiate-"

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: We should just watch the movie. That makes much more sense.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Or we can just sit and talk, though.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No. No more talking. It's movie time.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: I mean, are you sure...Um, yeah, I probably have a copy or two in my car.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, great. Great! So we're watching die hard, now. Good! This is a good plan.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [To Nellie in the kitchen] Here's the thing about moonlight. It's not sunlight.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [With his mouth full] I love this hog mama.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Dwight said it's "Hog maw."

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [Chokes and spits it out] What is maw?!

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Dwight walks in as Belsnickel]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's the lining of the stomach of-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Cackling] Ohh...[In a German Accent] Judgment is nigh, for the belsnickel ist I!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, he is finally nigh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am nigh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Every year, my grandfather would dress up as belsnickel at Christmas. He was...okay at it. I am great. You know how they say some people were born to be bad? Well, I was born to be belsnickel.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ooh, belsnickel has traveled from distant lands to discover how all the boys and the girls have been behaving this last year. Whoo hoo HOO hoo hoo! [Runs over to Stanley and points at his stomach with a stick] Ohh...Too much strudel.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So he's kind of like santa, except dirty and worse.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, much better-No one fears santa the way they fear belsnickel.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow! It's my favorite part of Christmas. The authority.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And the fear.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, exactly!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Come on, Dwight, you're making this up.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [Reading from his phone] This is a real thing. "Belsnickel is a crotchety, fur-clad gift giver related to other companions of st. Nicholas in the folklore of southwestern Germany."

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Huh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, great. Seriously, you guys? Now you believe in Dwight's traditions, when some democrat looks it up on wikipedia?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [Continues reading] "His partner, zwarte piet, or black Peter, a slave boy, often portrayed in colorful pantaloons and blackface."

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Uh-Uh. No, Dwight. No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, come on. We don't blindly stick to every outmoded aspect of our traditions. Come on, get with the spirit of it, you guys. [Texts warehouse worker, Nate, to forget showing up as zwarte piet]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Nate starts walking towards the door, gets the text, and walks back to his car]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Pete and Erin watching die hard on a computer]

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Okay, Karl was actually a ballet dancer in real life. Isn't that crazy?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Mm. [Chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Daryl drinking the gluhwein in his office, with some alcohol mixed in]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [Talks drunk angry] Jim, that guy. [Scoffs] You gotta stick to your word! Like when you say something to a buddy, a real buddy...what are you gonna do, lie? To your buddy? [Sighs] It's awful.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Take a bowl and pass it down.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Thank you, Dwight. These are nice.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, these are gift bowls. When you recieve a gift, it will go in the bowl, but the bowls must be returned at the end. They're a set. Now, hold your bowls forward. The belsnickel will decide if you are impish or admirable.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, it's like naughty or nice.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, impish or admirable.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Quick question-Do you just decide who gets what in the moment, or did you make a list?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I decided earlier.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, nice. Did you check that list?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Of course I checked it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But more than once? 'cause you could have made a mistake.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I checked it more than once.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, so you made a list, you checked it twice, and now you're gonna find out who's-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Impish or admirable.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Damn.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Phyllis Vance! Cheer or fear? Belsnickel is here! I judge your year as...admirable. [Jim claps] There you are.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [Takes here gift out of her bowl] Oh. What are these?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a set of rubber gaskets for canning jars.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'd rather have the bowl.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You can't have the bowl! Oscar Martinez, cheer or fear? Belsnickel is here! I judge your year [looks over at Angela, then back to Oscar]...as impish! [Smacks Oscar with a stick]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Angela smiles smugly]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Ow! You hit people with that thing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, I'm carrying around the stick in order to look cool. For the kinder [puts a mouse trap in Pam's bowl]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ooh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Holds the mouse trap up] Mouse trap.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [While Dwight is decided on others, he puts canning jars in Angela's bowl, and a twig in Stanley's, then a normal talking head]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: In a head-to-head contest, people prefer belsnickel over santa every time. There aren't as many songs about him, but I attribute that more to rhyming difficulties. My brother and I wrote one once. it was about a fickle pickle salesman who would tickle you for a nickel.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Kevin giggles as Dwight is poking him with a stick for being impish]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, you know what? I gotta go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stop giggling.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, really? Already?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, it's all right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a punishment. [Turns to Jim] Hey, where are you going?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I have to go to philly. But this was amazing. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But you work tomorrow.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I know, I'd just like to settle in and get a good night's sleep.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But we were gonna break the pig rib.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ooh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Remember?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No matter! Belsnickel cares not about this-off with you!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Perfect. Merry Christmas, everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, wait, wait, wait! Don't you want to know your present?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? Yeah. Have at it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim Halpert. Cheer or fear? Belsnickel is here! [Jim holds his hands like a bowl] I judge your year as impish. [Hits Jim with stick]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ooh! Are you nuts?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Hits Jim three more times] I judge you impish!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ow! Ow! Okay, that is three, and you didn't hit anybody that hard.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They're not abandoning the party. [Hit's Jim again]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Just-Just-Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Dwight hits him again]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [As he's walking out] That's enough, I'm done! Okay? Agh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Hits Jim some more] Impish! [Chases Jim out]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Aah! Ow!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Belsnickel, I gotta run out early too. [Leans up against the wall as Dwight comes back in]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Everyone groans. And in his office, Daryl continues to drink the gluhwein]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [In the parking lot, holding his side, walking to the taxi, Pam follows] Oh...what was that? Now I'm gonna be all whipped for my first day at work. God. [To taxi driver] One second. Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well...this is it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm probably never gonna see you again.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Shut up. I'm trying to be serious.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, sorry, sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I can't believe this is actually happening.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Listen, thank you so much for putting that all together. That was the perfect last Christmas party. All right, wish me luck.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. [Jim and Pam hug] Good luck. You're gonna be great.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'll call you when I get in.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Love you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Love you.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Jim gets in taxi and it drives away]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Party's over. You quit on Christmas, Christmas quits on you. [To camera] And guess what, kids. Belsnickel isn't real. It's me, Dwight! [Takes off hat and beard]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Everyone putting up normal Christmas decorations as Phyllis has a talking head]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: We found some old decorations in the warehouse. Oscar ran to the store for some food and drink, and I dipped into my stash of eggnog. I guess they needed me after all. It's like in it's a wonderful life when Jimmy Stewart realizes that all thos people at the building and loan were just jerks, and he was the real hero.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Kevin dressed up as Santa, helps Angela down from hanging lights]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Kevin. Kevin! Aaah. Stop it!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, it sounds like the party's starting up out there.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah. So anyway, the entire jury wants me to vote guilty. But then I did a little research of my own, and forget everything you thought you knew about fingerprinting.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Meredith's a little cute. I'm just realizing. She got, like, a Emma Stone thing.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Daryl comes out of the conference room and starts dancing. Meredith joins him]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [At Meredtith] Boo!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: For what it's worth, I liked your party better.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Everyone thought the food was gross, and that belsnickel was some darkly erotic freak.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think anyone thought that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim couldn't even stay till the end of the party.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, that didn't have anything to do with you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't care. Guess how much I care on a scale of one to ten.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Zero.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Damn It!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'm gonna tell Jim to go [Bleep] himself.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Do you think Andy would ever jump off an exploding building tied to a hose for me?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Yeah. Definitely. [Erin starts to cry] Hey, what's-Oh, no, come here. [Starts to put his arm around Erin] Hey, hey. Come on, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [Sliding away from Pete] I'm still Andy's girlfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, of course. I know.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: But you can leave your arm.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Pete puts his arm back around Erin as she slides closer to him]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Back at the party, Angela sits on Kevin's lap, everyone talking and enjoying the party]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, want me to get you some eggnog?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, thanks. I'll just have another dumatril. Jim taught me this really cool way to take it. You crush it into a powder, and you snort it up your butt.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Walks back into The Office] Yep, I did say that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's going on? Where's the belsnickel?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh-Oh my god!

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Pam goes to hug Jim, but Dwight runs and hugs Jim first]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you doing? Last time I saw you, you were whipping me out of the building.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Holds his finger to Jim's lips] Shh. Let's not speak of that. The Pig Rib! We could totally break the pig rib! I'm gonna dig it out of the trash! [High fives Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What happened? Did you miss your bus?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. I just missed my wife.[Gives Pam a hug and a kiss]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Comes back in, holding up the pig rib] I found it!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And I found out that there's a bus at 5:00 a.m.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [All cheering and chanting as Jim and Dwight try and break the pig rib]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh! [Pig rib breaks and Jim wins, and stuff splatters people. Everyone groans] Damn It! Jim got the bigger half.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Jim fist bumps Kevin and holds up the pig rib. Daryl sits in his office]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [To himself] Back for more, huh? [Gets up and walks towards Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ooh, nog it. Let me get some nog. [Everyone talking Phyllis pours Jim some eggnog, as Daryl walks in] Thanks, Phyllis. Where's Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, man. [Daryl walks over to Jim, angrily and stares at Jim] Oh, you know what? Before I forget again, I talked to the guys about hiring you. They're gonna bring you in for an interview.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [Looking at Jim confused] That's great.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Thanks, man.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, of course.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I shall come by at your convenience.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you, sir. [Tips his glass to Daryl]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [Claps his hands once, spins around] Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Go get 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [Falls backwards onto the food table] Oh! Whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Everyone shouts alarmidly]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Very impish.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Nellie and Toby back in the kitchen, Nellie looks bored and standing against the fridge. Toby walking around]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Two dimes, seven nickels-Well, okay, no, that doesn't add up. It was one quarter and-

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Shh. [Puts her finger to Toby's lips]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: What? I was just explaining-

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Shh.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Why wouldn't it-

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [Put her finger to his lips again] Shh.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: But why?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: No...more...talking.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Are you gonna kiss me?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yes. [Kisses Toby]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Toby takes his glasses off and him and Nellie go against fridge and start to make out]
